Key Arguments: The legislation exempts government and corporate media, which are the main parties it should apply to.
The bill threatens transparency, freedom of speech, and democracy.
Public consultation is inadequate and likely biased towards government-friendly NGOs.
The determination of what constitutes misinformation is problematic and could be abused by the government.
The legislation could be used to permanently label inconvenient truths as misinformation.
Main Themes: Threats to freedom of speech and democracy
Potential for government abuse of power
Notable Quotes: This bill comes across as the broadcasted intention of the government to continue lying to the public and using the media as a propaganda unit for hire.
Best to trash this bill and start again, it’s far too easily abused…. however that is no doubt the entire point of it.
